section.heading: Disciplinary or adverse action against nursing education or nursing assistive personnel training programs.

para.text: The Board of Nursing, subject to the right to a hearing provided by § 3-1205.19, may deny or withdraw approval of a nursing education program or a nursing assistive personnel training program, if:
The program fails to meet the standards established by the Mayor through rulemaking;
The program, or an individual responsible for the program, fails to conduct its business with honesty and fair dealing toward its employees, its students, the government, or the public;
The program, or an individual responsible for the program, has engaged or attempted to engage in falsification of documents or records;
The program, or an individual responsible for the program, fraudulently or deceptively obtains or attempts to obtain approval of a program; or
The program, or an individual responsible for the program, has violated any applicable District law or regulation.
